description: From French adsorber, from Latin ad- (“to”) + sorbere (“suck in”).

verbs.description: adsorb (third-person singular simple present adsorbs, present participle adsorbing, simple past and past participle adsorbed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, chemistry, physics) To accumulate on a surface, by adsorption
examples: The gas was purified by adsorbing the impurities onto active carbon.
